result.execSummary:
The defendant Isaiah N Ortega was found guilty of the following charge(s) in this case. One or more other charges in this case were dismissed. The dismissed charges were not proven and have no legal effect. Isaiah N Ortega is presumed innocent of the dismissed charges.

  • Isaiah N Ortega was found guilty of Carry Concealed Weapon, a class A misdemeanor, Wisconsin Statutes 941.23(2).
  • Isaiah N Ortega was found guilty of Receiving or Concealing Stolen Property (<=$2500), a class A misdemeanor, Wisconsin Statutes 943.34(1)(a).

Notice to employers: It may be a violation of state law to discriminate against a job applicant because of an arrest or conviction record. Generally speaking, an employer may refuse to hire an applicant on the basis of a conviction only if the circumstances of the conviction substantially relate to the particular job. For more information, see Wisconsin Statute 111.335 and the Department of Workforce Development's publication, Arrest and Conviction Records under the Law.

supervisions.notes: Each ct concur. May terminate at 18 mo with agent permission.

miscConds.notes: DA has 90 days to prepare/submit order.

$200 DNA surcharge remitted. $243  to be collected by the Dept of Corrections.  Court financial obligations shall be paid at the rate of 25% of the prison wages and work release funds.  Restitution shall be paid pursuant to separate court order.  The balance remaining at release from prison be paid as a condition of extended supervision or parole at a rate determined by the supervising agent.
Maintain full-time employment/education or combination of or be seeking same, and treatment.
Maintain absolute sobriety.  Defendant shall not have any contact, direct or indirect, with bars, taverns, liquore stores or 5800 block of Schumann Dr, Fitchburg. No contact with WC, JM or SSM.
Any other conditions DOC, Probation/Parole Department may impose.
$253  to be collected by the Dept of Corrections.
All other conditions are the same as count 2.

result.caption: State of Wisconsin vs. Isaiah N Ortega

Your signature bond is set in the amount of $500 per case . You may be responsible for paying this amount if you miss a court date or do not follow conditions of your release.
  - If the defendant fails to comply with Dane County Bail Monitoring, cash bail is automatically set in the amount of $2000 per case, as higher cash bail is necessary to assure appearance in court. If Defendant posts this higher amount of bail and is released from jail, the Sheriff is directed to notify DCBM. If Defendant is out of custody, supervision by DCBM is required to enforce conditions of release and protect the public. Defendant is ordered to cooperate with DCBM.
  - Defendant shall not have any contact, direct or indirect, with W.B.C., I.D.H., S.S.M., Joseph M., or Kimberly M.
